001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.decorators;
002
003import java.util.IdentityHashMap;
004import java.util.Map;
005import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
006
007/**
008 * Factory for creating and caching decorated instances of objects.
009 *
010 * <p>This class provides a mechanism to dynamically apply decorators to objects at runtime,
011 * ensuring that the same decorated instance is reused whenever possible.
012 *
013 * <p>The factory maintains a cache of decorated objects using an {@code IdentityHashMap},
014 * allowing efficient retrieval of previously created decorators. It uses reflection
015 * to instantiate decorators by searching for a constructor that accepts the target
016 * object's class or its superclass.
017 *
018 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
019 */
020@Component
021public class DecoratorsFactory {
022
023   /**
024    * Cache for storing decorated instances mapped to their original objects.
025    */
026   private final Map<Object, Object> cache = new IdentityHashMap<>();
027
028   /**
029    * Decorates a given target object with the specified decorator class.
030    *
031    * <p>If the target object has already been decorated with the requested class,
032    * the existing decorated instance is returned from the cache.
033    * Otherwise, a new decorator instance is created and stored.
034    *
035    * @param target         The object to be decorated.
036    * @param decoratorClass The class of the decorator to apply.
037    * @param <T>            The type of the target object.
038    * @param <K>            The type of the decorator class.
039    * @return The decorated instance, or {@code null} if the target is {@code null}.
040    * @throws IllegalStateException If no suitable constructor is found for the decorator.
041    */
042   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
043   public <T, K> K decorate(T target, Class<K> decoratorClass) {
044      if (target == null) {
045         return null;
046      }
047
048      if (cache.containsKey(target) && cache.get(target).getClass().equals(decoratorClass)) {
049         return (K) cache.get(target);
050      }
051
052      K decorator;
053      try {
054         decorator = decoratorClass
055               .getDeclaredConstructor(target.getClass())
056               .newInstance(target);
057      } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
058         try {
059            decorator = decoratorClass
060                  .getDeclaredConstructor(target.getClass().getSuperclass())
061                  .newInstance(target);
062         } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e2) {
063            throw new IllegalStateException(
064                  "Failed to create decorator. "
065                        + "No matching constructor found for " + decoratorClass.getName()
066                        + " with " + target.getClass().getName()
067                        + " or its superclass: " + target.getClass().getSuperclass().getName(),
068                  e2
069            );
070         }
071      } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
072         throw new IllegalStateException(
073               "Failed to create decorator " + decoratorClass.getName()
074                     + " for object " + target.getClass().getName(),
075               e
076         );
077      }
078
079      cache.put(target, decorator);
080      return decorator;
081   }
082}
